p: Results: Using a blood flow and dialysate flow rate of 1 ml/min, mean pre-filter partial pressure of CO[sub]2[/sub] (PCO[sub]2[/sub]) was 78 mmHg (±14) whereas mean post-filter PCO[sub]2[/sub] was 70 mmHg (±14) using Prismasol and 12 mmHg (±5) using our bicarbonate free dialysate (p < 0.001). Removal of bicarbonate did not significantly affect pH across the dialysis filter (0.003, p = 0.49). This translates to the removal of 0.041 ml/min (±0.0019) of CO[sub]2[/sub]. When scaled up to an adult dialysis filter of 0.9 m 2, with a blood flow of 200 ml/min, it’s the equivalent of removing 175 ml/min (±8.25) of CO[sub]2[/sub].
